title: The War of the Rohirrim ‚Äì "The Rider" by Paris Paloma Music Video

text: Posted in: Movies, Warner Bros | Tagged: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the RohirrimWarner Bros. has released 'The Rider' by Paris Palamo, an original song from the upcoming The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim.Article Summary Warner Bros. unveils Paris Paloma's "The Rider" for The War of the Rohirrim. The song's ethereal style perfectly complements Tolkien's universe. Fans eagerly await more marketing for The War of the Rohirrim. Set to release in theaters worldwide on December 13, 2024. If you've spent some time on Tiktok in the last couple of years, there is a decent chance you've heard some of¬†Paris Paloma's awesome song titled "labour." It's going viral again because of the events of the last week or so in the United States, but Paloma has a really beautiful style that seems like the opposite of what you would expect when you hear "This is a song that went viral on Tiktok and then became a thing." She's been releasing more music and touring, but this is such an excellent new step for her career. Today, Warner Bros. shared a new original song for The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim by Paloma. Her voice and style are perfect for the world of Tolkien; we hope this causes even more people to discover her awesome music. And maybe Warner Bros. will finally start marketing this film since it really does look like it has the potential to be beautiful. The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim ‚Äì¬†Summary, Cast List Release Date New Line Cinema's original anime feature The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim returns audiences to the epic world brought to life in The Lord of the Rings¬†Trilogy, based on the revered books by J.R.R. Tolkien. Under the direction of award-winning filmmaker Kenji Kamiyama (the Blade Runner: Black Lotus and Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex¬†TV series), the talented voice cast is led by Brian Cox (Succession) as Helm Hammerhand, the mighty King of Rohan; Gaia Wise (A Walk in the Woods) as his daughter H√©ra; and Luke Pasqualino (Snowpiercer) as Wulf. Miranda Otto, who delivered an unforgettable, award-winning performance in The Lord of the Rings¬†Trilogy, reprises her role as √âowyn, Shieldmaiden of Rohan, who serves as the tale's narrator. The voice ensemble also includes Lorraine Ashbourne (Netflix's Bridgerton), Yazdan Qafouri (I Came By), Benjamin Wainwright (World on Fire), Laurence Ubong Williams (Gateway), Shaun Dooley (The Witcher), Michael Wildman (Fast and Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw), Jude Akuwudike ("Beasts of No Nation"), Bilal Hasna (Sparks) and Janine Duvitski (Benidorm). Set 183 years before the events chronicled in the original trilogy of films, The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim¬†tells the fate of the House of Helm Hammerhand, the legendary King of Rohan. A sudden attack by Wulf, a clever and ruthless Dunlending lord seeking vengeance for the death of his father, forces Helm and his people to make a daring last stand in the ancient stronghold of the Hornburg‚Äîa mighty fortress that will later come to be known as Helm's Deep. Finding herself in an increasingly desperate situation, H√©ra, the daughter of Helm, must summon the will to lead the resistance against a deadly enemy intent on their total destruction. With Kamiyama at the helm, the original feature is being produced by Oscar winner Philippa Boyens, from the screenwriting team behind The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit¬†Trilogies, alongside Jason DeMarco and Joseph Chou, who, in addition to their many separate animation projects, collaborated on the Blade Runner: Black Lotus¬†series. The executive producers are Fran Walsh, Peter Jackson, Sam Register, Carolyn Blackwood, and Toby Emmerich. The screenplay is by Jeffrey Addiss & Will Matthews and Phoebe Gittins & Arty Papageorgiou, story by Addiss & Matthews and Boyens, based on characters created by J.R.R. Tolkien. The team of creative collaborators returning from The Lord of the Rings¬†Trilogy also includes Oscar winners Alan Lee and Richard Taylor, along with esteemed Tolkien illustrator John Howe. A New Line Cinema Presentation, a Warner Bros. Animation / Sola Entertainment Production, The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim, will be distributed theatrically worldwide by Warner Bros. Pictures, released in cinemas nationwide on December 13, 2024, and internationally beginning 11 December 2024. Enjoyed this? Please share on social media! html:
Posted in: Movies, Warner Bros | Tagged: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim

Warner Bros. has released 'The Rider' by Paris Palamo, an original song from the upcoming The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim.

Article Summary

  • Warner Bros. unveils Paris Paloma's "The Rider" for The War of the Rohirrim.
  • The song's ethereal style perfectly complements Tolkien's universe.
  • Fans eagerly await more marketing for The War of the Rohirrim.
  • Set to release in theaters worldwide on December 13, 2024.

If you've spent some time on Tiktok in the last couple of years, there is a decent chance you've heard some of¬†Paris Paloma's awesome song titled "labour." It's going viral again because of the events of the last week or so in the United States, but Paloma has a really beautiful style that seems like the opposite of what you would expect when you hear "This is a song that went viral on Tiktok and then became a thing." She's been releasing more music and touring, but this is such an excellent new step for her career. Today, Warner Bros. shared a new original song for The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim by Paloma. Her voice and style are perfect for the world of Tolkien; we hope this causes even more people to discover her awesome music. And maybe Warner Bros. will finally start marketing this film since it really does look like it has the potential to be beautiful.

The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim ‚Äì¬†Summary, Cast List Release Date

New Line Cinema's original anime feature The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim returns audiences to the epic world brought to life in The Lord of the Rings¬†Trilogy, based on the revered books by J.R.R. Tolkien.

Under the direction of award-winning filmmaker Kenji Kamiyama (the Blade Runner: Black Lotus and Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex¬†TV series), the talented voice cast is led by Brian Cox (Succession) as Helm Hammerhand, the mighty King of Rohan; Gaia Wise (A Walk in the Woods) as his daughter H√©ra; and Luke Pasqualino (Snowpiercer) as Wulf. Miranda Otto, who delivered an unforgettable, award-winning performance in The Lord of the Rings¬†Trilogy, reprises her role as √âowyn, Shieldmaiden of Rohan, who serves as the tale's narrator. The voice ensemble also includes Lorraine Ashbourne (Netflix's Bridgerton), Yazdan Qafouri (I Came By), Benjamin Wainwright (World on Fire), Laurence Ubong Williams (Gateway), Shaun Dooley (The Witcher), Michael Wildman (Fast and Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw), Jude Akuwudike ("Beasts of No Nation"), Bilal Hasna (Sparks) and Janine Duvitski (Benidorm).

Set 183 years before the events chronicled in the original trilogy of films, The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim¬†tells the fate of the House of Helm Hammerhand, the legendary King of Rohan. A sudden attack by Wulf, a clever and ruthless Dunlending lord seeking vengeance for the death of his father, forces Helm and his people to make a daring last stand in the ancient stronghold of the Hornburg‚Äîa mighty fortress that will later come to be known as Helm's Deep. Finding herself in an increasingly desperate situation, H√©ra, the daughter of Helm, must summon the will to lead the resistance against a deadly enemy intent on their total destruction.

With Kamiyama at the helm, the original feature is being produced by Oscar winner Philippa Boyens, from the screenwriting team behind The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit¬†Trilogies, alongside Jason DeMarco and Joseph Chou, who, in addition to their many separate animation projects, collaborated on the Blade Runner: Black Lotus¬†series. The executive producers are Fran Walsh, Peter Jackson, Sam Register, Carolyn Blackwood, and Toby Emmerich. The screenplay is by Jeffrey Addiss & Will Matthews and Phoebe Gittins & Arty Papageorgiou, story by Addiss & Matthews and Boyens, based on characters created by J.R.R. Tolkien. The team of creative collaborators returning from The Lord of the Rings¬†Trilogy also includes Oscar winners Alan Lee and Richard Taylor, along with esteemed Tolkien illustrator John Howe.

A New Line Cinema Presentation, a Warner Bros. Animation / Sola Entertainment Production, The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim, will be distributed theatrically worldwide by Warner Bros. Pictures, released in cinemas nationwide on December 13, 2024, and internationally beginning 11 December 2024.

Enjoyed this? Please share on social media!

About Kaitlyn Booth

Kaitlyn is the Editor-in-Chief at Bleeding Cool. Film critic and pop culture writer since 2013. Ace. Leftist. Nerd. Feminist. Writer. Replicant Translator. Cinephillic Virtue Signaler. She/Her. UFCA/GALECA Member. üçÖ Approved. Follow her Threads, Instagram, and Twitter @katiesmovies.

Latest by Kaitlyn Booth

Ice Age 6 Replaces An Untitled Star Wars Movie In 2026

Disney has removed an Untitled Star Wars film, set to be released December 18, 2026, from the release schedule and replaced it with Ice Age 6.

Kraven the Hunter: "Making Of A Villian" Behind-The-Scenes Featurette

Sony Pictures has released a new behind-the-scenes featurette for Kraven the Hunter, describing it as "the story of the making of a villain."

Lupita Nyong'o Has Joined The Cast Of Christopher Nolan's New Film

Lupita Nyong'o has reportedly joined the cast of Christopher Nolan's new film at Universal, which will be released on July 17, 2026.

The Amateur: Official Trailer, Poster, And 4 HQ Images Released

20th Century has released the official trailer, poster, and four high-quality images from The Amateur. It will be released in theaters on April 11, 2025.

A Complete Unknown: 5 New Character Posters Spotlight The Cast

Searchlight has released five new character posters for A Complete Unknown, which will be released on December 25th. James Mangold directs the film.

Moana 2: Moana's Mother Wants Her To Take A Crew On This New Adventure

Disney has released a short clip from Moana 2 in which Moana's mother argues that she needs a crew for this new adventure.

Latest in Movies

Y2K Gets A Second Trailer From A24, Film Opens On December 6th

A24 released another trailer for comedy Y2K, releasing in theaters in a couple of weeks on December 6th. Could this be a breakout?

Ice Age 6 Replaces An Untitled Star Wars Movie In 2026

Disney has removed an Untitled Star Wars film, set to be released December 18, 2026, from the release schedule and replaced it with Ice Age 6.

Ironheart Overview Focuses on Tech vs. Magic; Image, Cast Lineup

Hitting Disney+ on June 24, 2025, here's an official image, overview, and lineup for Dominique Thorne and Anthony Ramos-starring Ironheart.

Lanterns: DC Studios Series Taps Poorna Jagannathan for Recurring Role

Reports are Chris Mundy, Damon Lindelof, and Tom King's Green Lantern series Lanterns has tapped Poorna Jagannathan for a key recurring role.

Eyes of Wakanda: Marvel Animation Confirms Voice Cast; Image, Overview

Marvel Animation confirmed the impressive voice cast for "Black Panther" series Eyes of Wakanda and included an official image and overview.

Conan O'Brien Officially Set to Host 97th Oscars Ceremony

The Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences (AMPAS) confirmed that Conan O‚ÄôBrien will host the 97th Oscars Ceremony in March 2025.
